Web Development Glossary

The A-Zs of Web Development

The A-Zs of the Web Development

iFrame

iFrame is an HTML tag that allows developers to embed external content within a webpage, which can be used in Wordpress to display content from other websites or applications.

Include File

An include file in WordPress is a separate PHP file that can be included in other PHP files to reuse code and improve maintainability.

IP Address

An IP address is a unique numerical identifier assigned to a device connected to a network, which can be used to track and manage user activity on a Wordpress website.

JavaScript

JavaScript is a client-side scripting language used in WordPress to add interactivity and dynamic functionality to web pages.

jQuery

jQuery is a fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library that simplifies HTML document traversing, event handling, and animating for WordPress developers.

Lightbox

Lightbox is a JavaScript library that allows for the display of images and videos in a pop-up window on a WordPress website.

localhost

Localhost is the default hostname for the local computer used for developing and testing WordPress websites locally.

Loop

A loop in WordPress is a PHP code structure that iterates through a set of posts or pages and displays them on a webpage.

Media Settings

Media Settings in Wordpress are a configuration panel that allows users to set default sizes for images, choose the location for uploaded files, and enable/disable certain media-related features.

Media

Media in Wordpress is a built-in feature that allows users to upload and manage various types of digital content such as images, videos, and audio files.
